Identifying Read-Only Folders and Items

If a folder or item is read-only, its contents or properties cannot be changed. Also, new revisions cannot be checked into the application.

A folder or item will be read-only if it is:

  • In a read-only reference view. Read-only reference views that are not floating cannot be rolled back.

  • In a view currently configured to a view label, promotion state, or a date/time in the past.

  • In a view with a current configuration, but both of the following are true:

    • The configuration of the folder or item is set to a past state based on a label, promotion state, or a date/time in the past.

    • The branching behavior of the folder or item is disabled or not set to Branch on change.

For example, if you create a new view based on a label, promotion state, or a date and time in the parent view, this action automatically configures the new view (and all the folders and items it contains) to a past state. Selecting Branch none for the new view makes every folder and item in the view read-only until individual folders or items are set to Branch on change or given floating configurations. Then the folders or items will either branch or change along with the corresponding items in the parent view.
